subtitle: Hello, I'm Jeffrey Mishlove. I'm going to
tell you something about me that I have
never mentioned on any of the videos up
until this moment. That is, I'm a real
fan of Bill Maher's program Real Time,
and even before that Politically
Incorrect. I've been watching Bill Maher
for decades and I love the guy. He's
got a great sense of humor, he has
incisive wit. I don't always agree with
him about many things, particularly his
attitude toward the paranormal. As you
might imagine I think, the best I can
figure, he thinks anything having to
do with the paranormal is superstition,
the sort of thing that he lumps together
with all sorts of religious folly. So, I
have a big bone to pick with Bill Maher.
But lately, when it comes to his politics
I'm in general agreement with him about
many, many things. Not everything. I think
he's a little bit harsher on Muslims
than I would be. But, in any case I can
say this. I watched his program last
night, the 3rd of August and I believe
it was very likely the very best episode
that I've ever seen of Bill Maher. So, I'm
excited about it. I'd like to share it
with you but I know it's going to be
very controversial because it was about
politics. Politics divides people
pretty muchâ€¦ well, I guess, you know my
father used to say, "Don't talk
about politics or religion with people,
you'll just get into trouble." He
was a businessman in a small town in
Wisconsin and that was probably very
good advice. He didn't even want his
family members to do it. But we are in an
era I think where it's unavoidable and I
feel very strongly about this. There were
things said in that Bill Maher episode
that touched me.
Part of it is the outrage, the absolute
outrage that I feel about what the
American people have been subjected to, a
president who just constantly lies.
One of the guests was Steve Schmidt
who is the former campaign chairman of
John McCain who has now formally,
officially left the Republican party.
I know many other Republicans are
leaving the Republican party and urging
their colleagues to vote for Democrats
in the upcoming election. It is so very
important in my opinion that there be
some checks and balances against this
president because the Republicans aren't
doing it. I mean just last week here's
what we had and my blood is boiling
over this. We had leaders of the
National Intelligence Services hold a
press conference to say how serious the
Russian threat is, that the Russians are
attacking our upcoming election which is
some 95, 94 days from now and that this
is very serious and that they're doing
everything they can to stop it. Well, we
know the president isn't really helping
them at all because the very same day in
one of his rallies
he said, "The whole Russian investigation
is a hoax and the Attorney General
should put an end to it." It's interfering
with him having a good relationship with
Putin, of all things. How can that be? Is
it a hoax or is it a serious threat?
How is it that the president of the
United States isn't on the same
team with his own appointed directors of
national security, the head of the FBI,
even the head of Homeland Security
and Intelligence. They're on different
pages altogether. Of course, it
gets far worse than that. For
those of you who have HBO I encourage
you to watch that Bill Maher episode if
you haven't. I'm sure it will be available
to you on Videos on Demand for those
of you who don't have HBO. I am linking
to some of the segments from that
program that are available now on
YouTube, so I can link to them. Now, I
should say this. Some of my closest
friends, people I have enormous
admiration for, are Trump supporters
and enthusiasts. Now, I do want to talk about
this notion of the Trump derangement
syndrome. Steve Schmidt made a point on
the Bill Maher program last night that
what is happening to the American public
when they are being bombarded by lie
after lie after lie from Trump every day.
I think according to The New York Times,
averaging seven lies a day. I'm told
that here in 2018, the first half of 2018
he had more lies than in all of 2017. Now,
I know they use a very liberal
definition of lies, but nevertheless
they are there. This example of where
Trump calls the Russia investigation a
hoax while his top appointed officials
are saying its very serious what's
going on right now. Trump wants to have
closer ties with Russia at the very
moment when they're attacking our
elections yet again. Well, Steve Schmidt
points out that he's wearing down the
public with this barrage. People
are just getting weary of it. Bill
Maher is suggesting,
where is the anger, why aren't people
really up in arms? Well, of course, you
know, we are a republic, we are a
democracy, we're not accustomed to having
all the values that have made this
country great for 200 years being in
effect trashed. But I want to say this
about the Trump derangement syndrome
which is the common phrase used by Trump
supporters to kind of dismiss the anger
that other people feel about Trump. He is
engaging in a process which is very well
described in a 1930s movie called
Gaslight. He's gaslighting us. In that
movie a man deliberately tries to drive
his wife insane by creating all sorts of
false stories that he insists are true.
She can see they are false, so
what does she do? She questions her own
sanity until she becomes insane. That
seems to be what's going on. It's a very
dangerous process. In the meantime
the public is being distracted by
stories about porn stars and sexual
episodes and his attacks on LeBron James
and everybody. They miss what's
really going on where the whole country
in a way is being restructured, the court
appointments. I think if you watch
the Bill Maher episode you'll see a very
interesting interview with Nancy
MacLean, a professor at Duke University
who has analyzed, and of course it's all
public information actually, the real
agenda of the Koch brothers and this new
Supreme Court appointment to actually
rewrite the constitution to favor the
right wing agenda. That's going on very
quietly. In fact, she says 28 out of
the 34 required states have already
signed on to holding a new
constitutional convention for the first
time in our country's history since the
original Constitution Convention with
the
idea of rewriting, adding 10 new
amendments to the Constitution.
That's the Koch brothers agenda.
While it may seem as if Trump is
quarrelling publicly with the Koch
brothers he's onboard with their agenda.
His White House lawyer, Don McCann
was supposedly handpicked by Charles Koch.
You know I am not an expert on
politics, it's not my full time
profession. I'm not a political pundit. I
just have very strong feelings about it.
From time to time I need to share
them with you to get them off my chest
and to be honest with you about where I
stand.
I salute Bill Maher for having done the
best program I can recall. On the other
hand, I really hope that someday he takes
a fresh look at the parapsychology data.
Here we have the American Psychologist
publishing a review of decades
and decades of research in parapsychology
and the basic message is: 1) it's
consistent with leading edge science;
2) the data is very strong, there have been
hundreds and hundreds of replications
and the research was done under well
controlled conditions. That something
that everybody should be paying
attention to because this research is
truly revolutionary in terms of our
understanding of who we are, what it
means to be a conscious person.
Surely, a leading edge social critic like
Bill Maher should be paying attention to
this sort of thing. Well, where does this
leave you? What's in all of this for you?
I guess I'm asking you, because I know
most of you who view this program
are already sympathetic to my arguments
about parapsychology. But I ask you to
think deeply about what's happening to
this country right now. I see enormous
divisiveness. Of course, you can blame
all sides
for the division. But, shouldn't the president
of the United States be making an effort
to unify people? Why is he deliberately
over and over again trying to divide us?
What's the purpose behind that? Isn't
he
serving the agenda of Putin and the
Russians? Isn't that really what's going
on? As Americans should we be
standing for that? I'll mention one more
thing. In Bill Maher's closing monologue
in his New Rules, and I'm linking to it
right now, you will see his analysis of
why the entire Republican party seems to
be behind Trump and his effort to allow
Putin to call the shots as to US
government foreign and domestic policy.
Well, I'll leave you with those thoughts.
And of course, I'm happy to read all of
your feedback. I know many of you will
agree with me but there will be many who
don't. So, let me say this. One of the
things I really do admire about Bill
Maher is his willingness to engage in
dialogue with people who have very
different opinions than he holds. I
think that's a very positive attribute. I
hope that I embody that as well, at least
to some degree. So, thank you for being
with me.
